alert.note: Alert for Butte; Glenn (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 15 at 3:50AM PDT until further notice by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Sacramento River Above Bend Bridge affecting Tehama County. Sacramento River Below Red Bluff Diversion Dam affecting Tehama County. Sacramento River At Vina Woodson Bridge affecting Tehama County. Sacramento River At Tehama Bridge affecting Tehama County. Sacramento River Near Hamilton City affecting Glenn and Butte Counties. Sacramento River At Ord Ferry affecting Glenn and Butte Counties. For the Upper Sacramento River...including Bend Bridge, Red Bluff Diversion Dam, Tehama Bridge, Vina Woodson Bridge, Hamilton City, Ord Ferry, Butte City, Moulton Weir, Colusa Weir, Colusa Bridge, Tisdale Weir...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sacramento River at Ord Ferry. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 113.8 feet, Design overflow level for M&T, 3Bs and Goose Lake flood control facilities to divert flood flows into Butte Basin. M&T overflows close River Road from Ord Ferry Road to Chico Road. Ord Ferry Road is already closed. At 114.0 feet, Designated flood stage left bank. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 AM PDT Wednesday the stage was 110.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning and continue rising to a crest of 116.2 feet late this evening. - Flood stage is 114.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 116.2 feet on 02/28/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information and stage definitions refer to the following web site: wrh.noaa.gov/sto/hydro_data.php The next statement will be issued this evening at 615 PM PDT.
